title: extracting additional frames for labeling after creating training dataset with cropping

labels.name: WORK IN PROGRESS!
labels.description: developers are currently working on this feature... stay tuned.

body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** Windows 10, DLC 2.2b8, DLC-GPU anaconda env **Describe the problem** When trying to extract additional frames for labeling after a full training round when crop and label was true, DLC can't find videos because it's looking for \*_cropped.mov videos (looking in config file at video_sets, rather than video_sets_original). Please place code inside this:
Code output

```python Do you want to extract (perhaps additional) frames for video: C:\Users\__\Box\research\studentProjects\birdTails\__\data\20190606\wand01\trial01\cam1_06-Jun-19_12-00-08_cropped.mov ? yes/noy Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\__\Miniconda3\envs\dlc\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\extract_frames.py", line 243, in extract_frames slider_width=slider_width, File "C:\Users\__\Miniconda3\envs\dlc\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\frame_extraction.py", line 212, in extract_frames cap = VideoReader(video) File "C:\Users\__\Miniconda3\envs\dlc\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\auxfun_videos.py", line 22, in __init__ raise ValueError(f'Video path "{video_path}" does not point to a file.') ValueError: Video path "C:\Users\__\Box\research\studentProjects\birdTails\__\data\20190606\wand01\trial01\cam1_06-Jun-19_12-00-08_cropped.mov" does not point to a file. ```

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Label, create training dataset with crop and label, train, evaluate, create a video with all detections 2. **realize that you should extract and label more frames** 2. extract frames (with user feedback on so as to select videos for extraction) 3. answer yes for any video **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. Sample directory organization: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9662673/93487782-9cc27900-f8d3-11ea-9d1f-6efaf6e12198.png) **Additional context** [Line 184 in frame_extraction.py](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/v2.2b8/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/frame_extraction.py#L184) loops through files in cfg: video_sets. But if crop and label was set to true on first pass, video_sets contains paths to "cropped" videos, which don't actually exist as videos, just as directories in labeled-images. So, frame extraction fails. Changing L184 to 'video_sets_original' fixes the problem, but then breaks the code when creating a project and extracting frames the first time around. Unless I'm missing something in the suggested workflow, I think this is a bug? I can see two possible fixes: 1. create video_sets_original when creating config file the first time, and any time code needs to reference actual videos (as in frame_extraction.py) have it reference cfg['video_sets_original'] 2. In frame_extraction.py use some kind of check (e.g. if video doesn't exist and 'cropped' is in video name), then try again after removing -cropped. For now, my workaround is to change the keys in config.yaml, but I know I'll eventually forget to change them and mess something up.
